definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Accordingly, it is argued that current price limits in China should be relaxed or exterminated.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我國應取消或放寬當前的漲跌幅限制。

sentences.english: The broadening views of family are expected to have an impact at Thanksgiving.
sentences.chinese: 放寬了的家庭觀念估計會對感恩節產生影響。

sentences.english: Word of this follows earlier proposals from political advisors, calling on the government to relax the policy.
sentences.chinese: 這來自政協委員們的早些建議，呼籲政府放寬政策。

sentences.english: She said, however, that because \"a very bad harm was done, \" the courts may grant some latitude.
sentences.chinese: 她說，因爲這個案件情節惡劣，法庭可能會放寬限制。

sentences.english: You can make it as small as a mustard seed or let it expand limitlessly.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把它變成如芥子般的渺小，或者放寬至無限大。

sentences.english: The indication for tympanoplasty has become broad.
sentences.chinese: 現在鼓室成形術的適應症已放寬。

sentences.english: For those whose English is prominent, BNUZ will relax restrictions on the admission line requirements accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 對英語成績突出者，可適當放寬錄取分數線要求。

sentences.english: In addition, property inheritance and conversed with the relevant provisions will be greatly relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 此外，有關房產繼承與轉增的相關規定也會大大放寬。

sentences.english: Economic policy is liberalized to encourage initiatives in production.
sentences.chinese: 放寬經濟政策以鼓勵生產的積極性。

sentences.english: British lawyers want the "know-your-customer" rules relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 英國律師們希望放寬“瞭解你的客戶”制度。

sentences.english: College degree holder. Outstanding high school or polytechnic school graduates.
sentences.chinese: 大專學歷，優秀的可放寬到高中或中專學歷。

sentences.english: Occupational licensure rules could be relaxed to create opportunities for people without formal education.
sentences.chinese: 可以放寬職業許可證發放規則，給正規教育的人機會。

sentences.english: Town Planning Board is set to relax height restrictions in WKCD.
sentences.chinese: 城規會將放寬西九發展的高度限制。

sentences.english: Close your eyes. clear your heart. let it go.
sentences.chinese: 閉上眼，放寬心，隨它去吧。

sentences.english: They eventually loosened the strait-jacket policy of republicanism .
sentences.chinese: 他們終於放寬了共和主義的嚴厲約束政策。

definition: to implement/to carry out/to put into practice
to expand/to enlarge/to broaden one's scope
to respond accordingly to/to adapt to/to cope with
to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
to bloom/to open/to be open (to the public)/to open up (to the outside)/to be open-minded/unrestrained by convention/unconstrained in one's sexuality
doorstep/sill/threshold/fig. knack or trick (esp. scheme to get sth cheaper)
